events.description: Basic purchase or spending of money
events.disclaimer: This event records a one-time purchase or expense from a selected envelope. It does not account for recurring costs, taxes, or the impact on other envelopes.

parameters.description: Which envelope the money comes from

events.description: gift of money from something
events.disclaimer: This event adds a one-time monetary gift to a chosen envelope. It does not simulate taxes, recurring gifts, or non-cash gifts.

parameters.description: Which envelope the money goes to

events.description: Start earning a salary from employment.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates salaried employment, calculating net pay after taxes and 401k contributions. It does not model job loss, promotions, or non-salary compensation.

parameters.description: Number of pay periods per year.

updating_events.description: Receive an increase in salary.
Receive a one-time cash bonus.
Adjust the percentage of income contributed to 401k.

parameters.description: When the new contribution rate takes effect

events.description: Start earning an hourly wage from employment.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates hourly wage employment, including taxes and 401k contributions. It does not account for overtime, tips, or job loss.

parameters.description: Number of hours worked per week.
Number of pay periods per year.

updating_events.description: Receive an increase in hourly wage.

parameters.description: New hourly wage rate after raise.

updating_events.description: Change the number of hours worked per week.

parameters.description: When the new hours take effect
New number of hours per week.

updating_events.description: Adjust the percentage of wages contributed to 401k.

parameters.description: When the new contribution rate takes effect

updating_events.description: Update the employer's 401k match rate.

parameters.description: When the new match rate takes effect

events.description: Start your own business by investing capital.
events.disclaimer: This event models starting a business with an initial investment. It does not simulate business growth, profits, or operational expenses beyond initial setup.

parameters.description: Which envelope the money comes from.
Envelope where business assets are tracked

updating_events.description: Start receiving business revenue.

parameters.description: Monthly income earned by the business.
Envelope where business income is deposited

updating_events.description: Incur a business loss from operations.

parameters.description: Amount lost due to business expense or failure.
Envelope where loss is deducted from

events.description: Transition from employment to retirement with withdrawals.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates regular withdrawals from a retirement envelope. It does not account for taxes, investment growth, or required minimum distributions.

events.description: Purchase a home with mortgage terms.
events.disclaimer: This event estimates the financial impact of purchasing a home based on key inputs including purchase price, down payment, mortgage term, interest rate, appreciation rate, and property tax rate. It generates a monthly payment and amortization schedule using standard fixed-rate mortgage formulas. The calculation does not account for additional homeownership costs such as HOA fees, maintenance, insurance, closing costs, or utilities.

parameters.description: Annual interest rate on the mortgage.
Envelope where house value is tracked
Annual tax as a percentage of home value.

updating_events.description: New professional appraisal of home value.

parameters.description: When the new appraisal takes effect

updating_events.description: Make an extra one-time payment toward principal.

parameters.description: When the extra payment is made
Which month the payment applies to.

updating_events.description: Make a mortgage payment late.
Sell your home and receive proceeds.

parameters.description: Final sale value of the house.
Envelope where house value is tracked
Envelope where sale proceeds are deposited

updating_events.description: Purchase insurance policy for the house.

parameters.description: Percentage of damage the policy covers.
Envelope where premiums are paid from

updating_events.description: Damage to property due to tornado.

parameters.description: Envelope where insurance payout is received

updating_events.description: Damage to property due to fire.

parameters.description: Envelope where insurance payout is received

updating_events.description: Damage to home due to flood.

events.description: Purchase a car with or without a loan.
events.disclaimer: This event models the purchase of a car, including loan terms and down payment. It does not include insurance, registration, maintenance, or resale value.

parameters.description: Length of car loan in years.
Annual interest rate for the loan.
Which envelope the money comes from.
Envelope where car value is tracked

updating_events.description: Pay off the car loan ahead of schedule.

parameters.description: When the early payment is made

updating_events.description: Pay for major car repairs.

parameters.description: Envelope where repair cost is paid from

events.description: Have a child and incur related early-life costs.
events.disclaimer: This event records the birth of a child and initial costs. It does not simulate ongoing expenses, tax credits, or changes in household income.

parameters.description: One-time costs for childbirth, setup, etc.
Which envelope the cost is paid from.

updating_events.description: Monthly childcare expenses after birth.

parameters.description: Monthly cost for daycare or other care.
Envelope where childcare costs are paid from

updating_events.description: Start saving for your child's college education.

parameters.description: Envelope where college fund is tracked

events.description: Get married and incur event-related expenses.
events.disclaimer: This event logs a one-time marriage cost. It does not affect taxes, household size, or simulate ongoing marital expenses.

parameters.description: Total cost of wedding and related expenses.
Envelope where wedding costs are paid from

events.description: Divorce settlement and legal costs.
events.disclaimer: This event records a one-time divorce settlement and legal fees. It does not simulate asset division, custody, or ongoing support payments.

parameters.description: Envelope where divorce costs are paid from

events.description: Death of the individual and end-of-life costs.
events.disclaimer: This event marks the end of the simulation for the individual. It does not model estate distribution, survivor benefits, or funeral costs.

events.description: Purchase a health insurance plan with monthly payments.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates purchasing health insurance with monthly premiums and deductible. It does not model provider networks, claim denials, or out-of-network costs.

parameters.description: Cost of health insurance per month.
Amount paid out-of-pocket before insurance applies.
Percent of expenses covered after deductible.
Envelope where premiums are paid from

updating_events.description: Major medical procedure or cost covered by insurance.

parameters.description: Full amount billed by the hospital or provider.
Envelope to cover the out-of-pocket portion.
How much must be paid first by the user.

events.description: Buy term life insurance to protect dependents.
events.disclaimer: This event models purchasing term life insurance with a fixed premium and payout. It does not simulate underwriting, policy lapses, or variable coverage.

parameters.description: Total coverage paid out upon death.
Duration of the term policy in years.

updating_events.description: Change to a higher coverage amount and premium.

parameters.description: When the coverage increase takes effect

events.description: Regular cash benefits from government programs.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates receiving regular government aid payments. It does not account for eligibility changes, taxes, or benefit reductions.

parameters.description: Number of days between each benefit payment.
Envelope where aid payments are received

events.description: Invest a lump sum into the stock market or similar vehicle.
events.disclaimer: This event models a lump-sum investment with an expected return. It does not simulate market volatility, taxes, or investment fees.

parameters.description: Envelope to which the investment is applied.

updating_events.description: Receive dividend payments from invested stocks.
Put in reoccuring deposits

events.description: Open a high-yield savings account that earns daily interest.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates opening a high-yield savings account with a fixed interest rate. It does not account for rate changes, fees, or withdrawal limits.

parameters.description: When the savings account is opened

events.description: Annual payment of federal and state taxes.
events.disclaimer: This event models a one-time tax payment. It does not simulate audits, penalties, or tax deductions/credits.

parameters.description: When the tax payment is made
Envelope where taxes are paid from

updating_events.description: Receive refund from overpaid taxes.

parameters.description: When the tax refund is received

events.description: Spend a recurring amount on monthly groceries.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates recurring grocery expenses. It does not account for price changes, dietary needs, or non-food purchases.

parameters.description: Envelope where grocery costs are paid from

events.description: Manually adjust the value of an envelope for tracking accuracy.
events.disclaimer: This event allows manual adjustment of an envelope's value. It does not validate the reason for adjustment or track adjustment history.

parameters.description: The value added or subtracted (negative values allowed).

events.description: Transfer money between envelopes with optional growth rate for destination.
events.disclaimer: This event transfers a specified amount between envelopes. It does not simulate transfer fees, delays, or currency conversion.

events.description: Receive a recurring income at a specified interval.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates recurring income deposits at set intervals. It does not account for missed payments, taxes, or income changes.

parameters.description: Number of days between each income payment.

events.description: Spend a recurring amount at a specified interval.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates recurring spending at set intervals. It does not account for price changes, missed payments, or spending categories.

parameters.description: Number of days between each spending event.
Envelope where spending is deducted from.

events.description: Transfer a recurring amount between envelopes at a specified interval.
events.disclaimer: This event simulates recurring transfers between envelopes. It does not include transfer fees, missed transfers, or currency conversion.

parameters.description: Number of days between each transfer.
Envelope where money is transferred from.
Envelope where money is transferred to.

events.description: Declare the initial balances of up to five financial accounts (envelopes) at a specific time.
events.disclaimer: This event is used to set the starting balances for up to five envelopes. It does not simulate transactions or transfers, only the initial state.

parameters.description: When the account balances are declared
